note_en: On the eve of his memoir 'Permanent Record' being published, NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden talked at length from Moscow with MSNBC's Brian Williams in an ...
title: 爱德华·斯诺登 (Edward Snowden) 谈隐私和民主威胁 (2019) [视频]

note:
在政策团队中，我经常听到开发人员说起草项目治理是一个痛点。出于这个原因，我们制作了最小可行治理 (MVG)，这是一个简单、易于实施的治理框架，适用于您的免费和开源项目。它应该适用于所有项目——那些在几个朋友或几个大型企业竞争对手中的项目。它是开源的，因此您可以对其进行修改以满足您的需要。当您的项目从 1 个维护者变为 1+N 个维护者时，事情会变得复杂。突然，您需要弄清楚您将如何做出决定，如何添加其他维护者，如何分工并就愿景达成一致，以及谁拥有商标。通常对这些决定的谈判要么太少要么太多。对于志愿者运营的项目，人们通常在出现问题之前什么都不做，而这些问题会使社区紧张或破裂。对于有大型企业贡献者的项目，律师会参与其中，并花费数月时间协商减慢实际工作的重量级法律治理结构。 MVG 是维护者之间签署并存储在存储库中的协议。 MVG 为一组开源项目提供了一个两层结构。在顶层（在 GitHub 上称为“组织”），您选择一组人作为技术指导委员会，就组织所有项目之间的总体方向和协调做出决策。在该顶层之下是各个项目，维护者之间具有轻量级、基于共识的治理。该协议涵盖五项内容，默认设置如下。由于 MVG 是开源的，您当然可以修改文档以满足您的需要。做决定。 MVG 在组织层面默认采用基于共识的决策过程。共识并不意味着不反对——它意味着利益相关者基于其主导观点的松散同意，并考虑到突出的反对意见。这就是构建网络的方法。根据我们的经验，争取共识可以减少摩擦并减少敌对的项目分叉。在组织/指导委员会层面，无法通过共识做出的决定会退回到多数票。单个存储库仅达成共识，因此如果无法通过共识做出决定，则可以向指导委员会提出上诉。商标政策。中立的商标所有权是真正开放的协作过程的有力指标。当项目有一个非营利性公司主页时，该公司主页拥有商标（如项目名称和徽标），以便为更广泛的社区的利益进行管理。如果没有公司住所，商标所有权就很复杂。 MVG 通过让与项目相关的每个人都同意受与与项目无关的相同商标政策的约束来解决这些复杂问题。 MVG 默认商标政策基于示范商标指南。
反垄断政策。该政策明确规定，使用 MVG 进行项目合作的参与者不会从事违反反垄断或竞争法的活动。这是良好的法律卫生，特别是如果有来自公司的维护者。行为守则。 MVG 默认为贡献者契约。这是 GitHub 开源社区使用最广泛的行为准则。项目标准。 MVG 适用于 GitHub 上的开源软件、开放标准、开放硬件和开放数据项目。默认情况下，MVG 包含一项策略，项目必须从有限的开源许可证列表中进行选择。对于开源项目，这些是 Open Source Initiative 的流行许可证列表，MVG 的模板项目许可证是 MIT——使用最广泛的开源许可证。 MVG 默认为标准的社区规范或开放 Web 基金会协议和开放知识基金会的数据推荐一致性许可列表。 MVG 的设计既简单又强大。一旦您查看并确保它适合您，请复制一份副本，填写空白，然后开始工作。 MVG 是开源的，遵循 CC-BY 许可，因此您可以修改文档以满足您的需要并重新共享它们。请记住，这些是合同，因此您应该确保它们适合您。 MVG 是一个入口匝道。如果您的项目取得成功并需要为聚会、会议演讲、托管费或其他任何事情存钱，则很容易将此结构转变为免费和开源软件基金会或其他公司形式。 MVG 仍处于测试阶段。我们需要您的反馈！有几个 alpha 版本正在使用中，但与所有事情一样，还有改进的余地。在我们发布 1.0 版本之前，我们将在接下来的几个月内在 MVG 存储库中接受任何人的反馈。最后，感谢许多 GitHub 团队成员以及在此 Beta 版发布之前审核并提供反馈的其他人，尤其是 Pam Chestek 和 Aaron Williamson。
在 Twitter 上关注 GitHub 政策，了解有关影响开发人员的法律法规的更新。
note_en:
In my role on the policy team, I hear a lot from developers that drafting project governance is a pain point. For that reason, we made  Minimum Viable Governance (MVG), a simple, easy-to-implement governance framework for your free and open source projects. It should work as-is for all projects—those among a few friends or a few mega-corporate rivals. It is open source, so you can modify it to fit your needs.
  Things get complicated when you move from 1 maintainer to 1+N maintainers of your project. Suddenly, you need to figure out how you’ll make decisions, how you’ll add other maintainers, how you’ll divide work and agree on a vision, as well as who owns the trademark.
 There is often either too little or too much negotiation over these decisions. For volunteer-run projects, people often do nothing until there are problems, and those problems can strain or break the community. For projects with large corporate contributors, lawyers get involved and spend months negotiating heavyweight legal governance structures that slow down real work.
  MVG is an agreement between maintainers that is signed and stored in the repository. MVG provides a two-tier structure for a set of open source projects. At the top level (called an “ organization” on GitHub), you choose a group of people to serve as the technical steering committee, making decisions about the overall direction and coordination between all of the organization’s projects. Underneath that top level are the individual projects, with lightweight, consensus-based governance among the maintainers.
 The agreement covers five things, with the defaults set out below. Since MVG is open source, you can of course modify the docs to suit your needs.
 Decision making. MVG defaults to a consensus-based decision making process at the organization level. Consensus does not mean no objection – it means loose agreement by the stakeholders based on their dominant view, and taking outstanding objections into consideration.  This is the approach that built the net. In our experience, striving for consensus reduces friction and reduces hostile project forks. At the organization/steering committee level, decisions that can’t be made by consensus fall back to majority vote. Individual repositories are consensus-only, so if a decision can’t be made by consensus, it’s appealed to the steering committee.
 Trademark policy. Neutral trademark ownership is a strong indicator of a truly open collaboration process. When projects have a non-profit corporate home, that corporate home owns the trademarks—like the project name and logo—so that they are managed for the benefit of the broader community. Without a corporate home, trademark ownership is complicated. MVG hacks these complications by having everyone associated with the project agree to be bound by the same trademark policy as those not associated with the project. The MVG default trademark policy is based on the  Model Trademark Guidelines.
 Antitrust policy. This policy makes clear that participants collaborating on projects using MVG will not engage in activities that would violate antitrust or competition laws. This is good legal hygiene, particularly if there are maintainers from corporations.
 Code of conduct. MVG defaults to the  Contributor Covenant. This is the code of conduct most widely used by GitHub’s open source communities.
 Project criteria. MVG is meant for open source software, open standards, open hardware, and open data projects on GitHub. By default, MVG includes a policy that projects must select from a limited list of open source licenses. For open source projects, these are Open Source Initiative’s  list of popular licenses, and MVG’s template project license is MIT—the most widely used open source license. MVG defaults to the  Community Specification or  Open Web Foundation Agreements for standards and the Open Knowledge Foundation’s list of  Recommended Conformant Licenses for data.
  MVG is designed to be simple, yet robust. Once you review and make sure it’s right for you, fork a copy, fill in the blanks, and get to work. MVG is open source, under a  CC-BY license, so you can modify the docs to suit your needs and reshare them. Remember these are contracts, so you should make sure they’re right for you.
 MVG is meant to be an on-ramp. If your project takes off and needs to hold money for meetups, conference talks, hosting fees, or anything else, it’s easy to take this structure to a  free and open source software foundation or other corporate form.
  MVG is still in beta. We want your feedback! There are a  few  alpha  versions in use, but like all things, there is room for improvement. We’ll be accepting feedback from anyone over the next few months  in the MVG repo before we release a 1.0 version.
  Finally, thanks to the many GitHub teammates and other folks who reviewed and provided feedback prior to this beta release, particularly  Pam Chestek and  Aaron Williamson.
  Follow  GitHub Policy on Twitter for updates about the laws and regulations that impact developers.
title: 最小可行治理

note: -----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----Hash: SHA256 大家好，发布日期============我们计划在2021-08-14发布。如果你想庆祝它（以及您周围的条件允许），请考虑参加 Debian 发布派对，或举办您自己的派对！有关更多信息，请参阅 https://wiki.debian.org/ReleasePartyBullseye。发布前的最后几周============================ ======在冻结前的最后一周，测试将被完全冻结，在此期间只会考虑紧急错误修复。请考虑 UTC 时间 2021-08-03 星期二 12:00 提交解锁的绝对最后时刻对 Bullseye 的请求。当时尚未准备好迁移到测试的更改将不会包含在初始版本的 Bullseye 中。但是，如果变更集遵循 stable 中的更新规则，您仍然可以通过点发布修复 Bullseye 中的错误。从现在开始，我们将在考虑取消阻止请求时更加严格。请检查下面的详细信息并确保仅上传经过良好测试的*有针对性的*修复。总结：vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv * **取消阻止请求** 截止日期：> 2021-08-03 12:00 UTC < ^^^^^^^^ ^^^^^^^^^^^^ - 你必须在*之前*提交你的解锁请求 - 你的更改必须在那个时候准备好迁移到牛眼 - 在截止日期*之前*几天上传 * 如果更改是晚了，它可能仍然适用于在 Bullseye 发布后通过点发布进行的更新。 * 请注意，自动删除仍然有效，并且可能仍会删除该日期之前的软件包。此外，某些软件包将在自动删除截止日期之前手动删除。请在今天而不是在截止日期前不久修复错误。简单的错误（无论如何都是微不足道的）或繁忙的构建队列最终会导致您的上传错过靶心发布。靶心的未来更新直到冻结=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=- =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=当我们进入冻结的最后部分时，请将未来更改和取消阻止请求限制为： * 针对发布关键错误的针对性修复（即，严重性严重、严重和严重的错误）； * 修复严重性：重要的错误，只有当这可以通过不稳定来完成时； * 翻译更新和文档修复，只有当这可以通过不稳定来完成时（最好与上面列出的至少一个问题的修复捆绑在一起，没有别的） * 更新与发布过程直接相关的包（即引用档案的当前布局），只有当这可以通过不稳定来完成时；我们只接受有针对性的修复。不接受包括其他更改在内的请求。请不要上传新的上游版本tounstable.For发布团队，保罗----- BEGIN PGP签名----- iQEzBAEBCAAdFiEEWLZtSHNr6TsFLeZynFyZ6wW9dQoFAmD7HuUACgkQnFyZ6wW9dQqAFwf / Tv9mne / jKwgXrMAYe8wgH5ggfh / p3nvTfeD3Nx9sqN5D3RtmKQCLPKRb0LsguOQGARVH7U7FVKyQDn810Ussh8lU40sxetmcSncXFG9YcT3Oe3YrWk4RDoWUhS + KrFNkjXA9cB4tY / jr9lnhyrCe + X + rNVLfg2q20BJaOyAyyNosv + GRH / mafAVS6BFYC + 9wmNcr5O7 / DJChl7RmUnHxiluKWVGdDssixnxNH5OGmp62JEwQnwkwkzAtdNS9iabGXi8In2EIEk1Bmn8U1QgWx87MbaiBTK/kxCmhgPyRJI8Nf5PmZtsCJQTYCO3QOYS-A-PmZtsCJQTYCO3VZ-G-----jMVYZ-G----vqyqyztg----vgp
note_en: -----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----Hash: SHA256Hi all,Release date============We plan to release on 2021-08-14.If you want to celebrate it (and the conditions around you allow forit), please consider attending a Debian release party, or hosting yourown! See  https://wiki.debian.org/ReleasePartyBullseye for moreinformation.The final weeks up to the release=================================In the last week prior to the freeze, testing will be completelyfrozen and only emergency bug fixes will be considered in this period.Please consider Tuesday the 2021-08-03 at 12:00 UTC the absolute lastmoment for submitting unblock requests for bullseye.Changes that are not ready to migrate to testing at that time willnot be included in bullseye for the initial release. However, you canstill fix bugs in bullseye via point releases if the changeset followsthe rules for updates in stable.Starting now, we will be even more strict when considering unblockrequests. Please check the details below and make sure to only uploadwell-tested *targeted* fixes.In summary: vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv * **Unblock request** deadline: > 2021-08-03 12:00 UTC < ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ - You must submit your unblock request *before* then - Your changes must be ready to migrate to bullseye at that time - Upload several days *before* the deadline * If a change is late, it may still be applicable for an update via a point release after bullseye has been released. * Please note that the automatic removals are still in effect and may still remove packages up to that date. Also, some packages will be removed manually before the auto-removal deadline.Please fix bugs today rather than shortly before the deadline. Simplemistakes (no manner how trivial) or busy buildd queue can end upcausing your upload to miss the bullseye release.Future updates to bullseye up to the freeze=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=As we are entering the final part of the freeze, please keep futurechanges and unblock requests limited to: * targeted fixes for release critical bugs (i.e., bugs of severity critical, grave, and serious); * fixes for severity: important bugs, only when this can be done via unstable; * translation updates and documentation fixes, only when this can be done via unstable (preferably bundled with a fix for at least one of the problems listed above and nothing else) * updates to packages directly related to the release process (i.e. with references to the current layout of the archive), only when this can be done via unstable;We will only accept targeted fixes. Requests including other changeswill not be accepted. Please do not upload new upstream versions tounstable.For the release team,Paul-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----------END PGP SIGNATURE-----
title: Debian Bullseye 计划于 2021-08-14 发布
